intro: Braya longii, commonly known as the longstem sandwort, is a small flowering plant native to arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. Braya longii is often found in disturbed or open habitats, such as along roadsides or in desert scrub.
